tr.td: Resting membrane potential (RMP) - average baseline of all sweeps (sweep - a single trace of voltage response to injected current step) in a trace.
Input resistance - regression coefficient between injected current steps and voltage responses, measured over the last 50 ms of each sweep without any action potentials (AP).

SAG depolarization (DP) - ratio between steady-state mean voltage computed over the last 50 ms of the current step in sweep with 100 mV membrane voltage and maximum hyperpolarization in the same sweep.
Rheobase current - amplitude of injected current step on which the first AP appeared.
Tau start or Membrane time constant - base of an exponential curve fit to the −100 mV sweep.
Number of spikes. From here on 1_spk (first spike) corresponds to the sweep evoked by rheobase current.
First Spike Latency or Delay - time interval between the beginning of the current step and that of the first AP.
Afterdepolarization (ADP) amplitude - difference between the afterhyperpolarization (AHP) peak and the most positive membrane voltage during the fast repolarization phase.
Set to 0 if no ADP was detected.
ADP latency - interval between the AHP and ADP peaks.
Set to 0 if no ADP was detected. Constant value of 0.2 (ms) was added to all estimates before log-transform.
AP amplitude - difference between the AP threshold and its positive peak.
AP half-width (HW) - time interval between voltage points corresponding to half of AP amplitude during depolarization and repolarization phase.
Threshold amplitude - voltage point before the first spike after which voltage grew faster than 10 mV/ms.
AHP amplitude - difference between the AP threshold and the most negative membrane potential reached during afterhyperpolarization.
AP decay time - Time from the AP peak to the AHP peak.
Number of spikes. From here on sat (saturation) corresponds to the sweep with the highest number of APs.
Saturating Current Step - injected current which evokes maximum number of APs.
Time interval between the beginning of the current step and that of the first AP.
Initial maximum frequency - Inverse of the shortest inter-spike interval (ISI) among the first three spikes.
Steady-state maximum frequency - Inverse of the average mean of the last three ISIs.
Mean difference between the AP threshold and its positive peak for all spikes.
Average time interval between voltage points corresponding to half of AP amplitude during depolarization and repolarization phase.
Mean voltage point after which voltage grew faster than10 mV/ms for all spikes.
Mean difference between the AP threshold and the most negative membrane potential reached during afterhyperpolarization.
Mean time from the AP peak to the AHP peak.
